means: 哈斯德鲁巴(? ～公元前207，迦太基将领)

sentence.Network_en: At this time in the war Rome was as afraid of Hasdrubal as it was Hannibal.
sentence.Network_cn: 这在罗马引起了恐慌,罗马人害怕他是第二个汉尼拔.

means.word_mean: 1. general who commanded a Carthaginian army in Spain; joined his brother Hannibal in Italy and was killed by the Romans at the battle of Metaurus River (died 207 BC)

auth_sentence.content: Hasdrubal McNulticlar, a Carthaginian circus impresario, apparently leased Hannibal the elephants he used to cross the Alps.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hasdrubal McNulticlar, a Carthaginian circus impresario, apparently leased Hannibal the elephants he used to cross the Alps.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hasdrubal McNulticlar, a Carthaginian circus impresario, apparently leased Hannibal the elephants he used to cross the Alps.

auth_sentence.content: Next up are Siddhartha, Hasdrubal, Montezuma, John of Gaunt, and finally my lifelong dream: Diocletian.
